programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: The Texas Rangers return to Victoria to celebrate their victory over Mexico and Houston is encouraged to take an important role in the future of the newly independent territory.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Australia's brumbies are widely regarded as pests and shot by choppers, so Matt Wright plans to relieve the problem by rounding up the horses and giving them a better life.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is impressed by a vintage caravan and a strange totem pole when he and Frank examine a veteran collector's hoard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look for old arcade games during a power cut. They also come across a collection of motorbikes, but realise they may not be for sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Karen comes up with a big idea for the shop, while Byron puts two ice hockey fans in their place when they get physical over a vintage puck.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The ladies working the redeem windows all take sick leave, leading Les and Ashley to believe that Seth's new policy is causing widespread discontent.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The guys restore a police phone box from New York, and Tyler brings a 1947 railway maintenance vehicle into the shop, but underestimates how much it will cost to repair.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick cannot refuse when a stock car racer asks him to repair a 1970s motorcycle, but may have taken on more than he can handle.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Following Joe's arrest, the employees express their displeasure when new security measures are implemented to make sure that no one steals anything.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The ladies working the redeem windows all take sick leave, leading Les and Ashley to believe that Seth's new policy is causing widespread discontent.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revolutionary war documents signed by King George III show up in the shop. Plus, Chumlee checks out a pair of Pushman Scooters.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed Red Hot Chili Peppers album and a Mobo Bronco toy are brought into the shop, and their true values leave everyone guessing.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Theorists investigate whether extraterrestrials might have inspired Adolf Hitler to embark on a crazed quest for global domination, and try to track down the Fuhrer's alien secret.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien theorists explore the origins of mythical gods, and examine whether the tales of superhuman beings could be based on sightings of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Van Halen singer Sammy Hagar challenges Rick to turn an old fridge into a rum dispenser, while the team works on a fixing a broken slot machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer brings Rick an arm wrestling game from the 1950s in need of repair.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is intrigued when a very valuable Pok√©mon collection makes its way into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a hat worn by Prince and a Second World War head-shaped grass planter is brought in.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi find a rare jewellery box, while Dave is reluctant to join in the bidding wars.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Bladesmiths are tasked to forge together rusty chain mail and high quality steel to produce Knights Templar crusader daggers. Later, two finalists are sent back to their home forges on a five-day quest to recreate the iconic Knights Templar crusader sword.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A baseball thought to be autographed by 1959 World Series Champions the LA Dodgers shows up, and Rick looks for a snappy deal on a rare 1930s movie camera.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey takes a look at a vintage pinball machine, while Chum is left in charge at his new bar and Rick examines a rare coin, known as a 'king of Morgan dollars', dating from 1895.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts unseal the truth about the potential aliens living and working among humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Startling evidence suggesting that the Ancient Maya conspired with aliens, as experts hypothesise that they acquired extraterrestrial knowledge of astrology.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After Seth rescinds his invasive search policies for his employees, the women to return to work. The leader soon wrestles with a new problem - profits are down, so he looks at creative ways to get new customers into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The staff receive complaints from customers that a staff member has been letting customers cut in line in exchange for a tip. They later find out that Anton, who works the pawn desk, is responsible.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and a pawnbroker toss a coin for a box of collectable scout badges.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Almost the Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Dave puts a bid in for a unit of motor parts, much to the surprise of the buyers, who thought he was broke.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team are all about cutting deals, but it remains to be seen what happens when Chum takes a stab at three Japanese Samurai swords.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 18th-century Tryal of Witches book is brought to the shop, as well as a gold-plated banjo, and the guys check out the restored car from Wayne's World.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must craft a hatchet from pieces of odd-shaped steel. After several forging failures, parameter mishaps and intense conditions, only two head back to their home forges, where they must re-create the deadly Maasai lion spear.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge and using his remarkable skills honed over a decade, Alec Steele re-creates a Scottish Claymore, a variant of the basket-hilted sword.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: UK blacksmith and YouTube personality Alec Steele hits the forge once again to craft the primary weapon of the Roman legion, the gladius sword.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi find a rare jewellery box, while Dave is reluctant to join in the bidding wars.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Alistair McGowan, Kevin Bridges and Reginald D Hunter
programme.desc: Impressionist Alistair McGowan hosts the comedy show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing Glaswegian Kevin Bridges and American Reginald D Hunter.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Him & Her star Joe Wilkinson, Stand Up for the Week's Josh Widdicombe and surreal comic Milton Jones join Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2012 edition of the satirical current affairs quiz.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian tries his hand at four distinctly unglamorous jobs, beginning by getting up early to sample the life of a refuse collector on the streets of Barry, Vale of Glamorgan.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Josh gets dumped by his girlfriend, so Owen takes him on a double date with a couple of voracious older women. Meanwhile, an e-mail mix-up leads to Kate breaking Geoff's heart. Sitcom, co-written by and starring Josh Widdicombe, with Elis James, Beattie Edmondson and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian's quest to sample four distinctly glamourless professions continues as he faces his toughest crowd yet - seven children for whom he becomes mother for a day.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: In Stoke, a suspected stolen car leads to a high-speed chase in the early hours of the morning. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a fellow picker's sheds and barns. The pair also examine the oddities collected by landowner John Atwater Bradley.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori team up with Mone as they try to win a helicopter at an auction.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages - with the opening episode featuring a bidding war over a mystery object, and the gang competing for a lot of occult objects and a coffin.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike tries to buy a set of art deco cigarette machines, and one of the duo's recent purchases leaves an appraiser speechless.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a huge sculpture of Elvis and trawl through a trailer full of rare art and military memorabilia.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit, and Blur bassist Alex James is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris go to Norway to test drive the latest estate cars from Porsche and Ferrari, while Rory Reid is joined by racing driver Sabine Schmitz for an unusual motoring challenge - to create Britain's newest mountain with the help of a tiny Suzuki. The team is joined in the studio by Westworld star James Marsden.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with comedians Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the topic of monsters.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Amanda Abbington, Michael Buerk, Shappi Khorsandi and Elis James test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian Bob Mortimer and actress Patsy Kensit join team captain Lee Mack, while comedy actor Greg Davies and Pointless co-host Richard Osman are enlisted by his counterpart David Mitchell. Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the two sides engage in a battle of wits to determine which of them can most successfully stretch the truth about their own lives.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by newsreader Huw Edwards and comedienne Sarah Millican, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes actor Bradley Walsh and actress Josie Lawrence. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Alistair McGowan, Kevin Bridges and Reginald D Hunter
programme.desc: Impressionist Alistair McGowan hosts the comedy show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing Glaswegian Kevin Bridges and American Reginald D Hunter.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: A group of comedians completes a series of tasks. This time, Sally Phillips faces an amorous water cooler, and Aisling Bea crams a dish into a balloon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Linda Smith, Mark Gatiss and Sean Lock for more interesting answers on subjects including B major, B minor and B flat in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian Bob Mortimer and actress Patsy Kensit join team captain Lee Mack, while comedy actor Greg Davies and Pointless co-host Richard Osman are enlisted by his counterpart David Mitchell. Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the two sides engage in a battle of wits to determine which of them can most successfully stretch the truth about their own lives.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Russian Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary exploring the overthrow of the Tsar and the rise of the Soviet state, using archive footage and dramatic reconstructions. When the Tsar ordered military force to be used against the demonstrators, many soldiers began to question their loyalties, forming a revolutionary committee to plot against their commanding officers.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How an oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico was inspired by the first drilled oil well, pioneering remote manipulator arms, and the discovery of fireproof chemicals.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: Mission: Kill Hitler
programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. Two soldiers parachuted into the area were supposed to find a perfect location to shoot Hitler and stop the devastating war. Based on the British Secret Services' declassified documents, using archives and fictionalised reconstitutions, this film recounts the full story and the detailed plan that should have led to the murder of Adolf Hitler, and explains why it failed..

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How an oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico was inspired by the first drilled oil well, pioneering remote manipulator arms, and the discovery of fireproof chemicals.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Experts look into new areas of technology to locate the SS Armenian, a cargo liner carrying 1,400 mules, which was sunk by a German U-Boat in 1915 but never found.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Barker and Corbett continue their gripping serial Done to Death, together with a classic monologue and a song from Chelsea Brown.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, with music by Thelma Houston.

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Tess's baby Sorrow dies after falling seriously ill and she is forced to bury him alone when Parson Tringham refuses. She then leaves home and finds work at a dairy farm, where she falls in love with Angel Clare and agrees to marry him. However, the bride-to-be suffers an attack of conscience the night before her wedding and decides to tell her prospective husband about her past. Gemma Arterton stars.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A singing star turns up at the surgery demanding a repeat prescription, but the exact nature of her illness proves elusive. Meanwhile, Dr Finlay considers starting afresh elsewhere. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Garden Rivals
programme.desc: Ann-Marie Powell offers a modern garden and Chris Collins puts forward a traditional design. Presented by 'Handy' Andy Kane.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: The elder Dr Bramwell plans to open a practice on Harley Street and proposes marriage to Mrs Costigan. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ramani and new DC Suzie Sim join forces in a bid to find out whether Terry's brother Ben has been abusing his son, while Honey attempts to deal with an emergency at St Hugh's hospital, only to find herself staring down the barrel of a gun. Back at the station, Jack resolves to give Jo Masters the benefit of the doubt - unlike Neil, who continues to seethe over her arrival.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will's wife publicly blames Connie for her husband's death, and makes an official complaint to the chief executive about her campaign of harassment. Owen returns from honeymoon, but Chrissie is determined not to let their illicit night together be forgotten, and Sean starts making wedding plans - despite the fact that Jess has not said 'yes' yet.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A newspaper report about Kate's arrest for shoplifting is seen by all the A&E staff and she decides to leave nursing. A woman's health regime puts her health at risk.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. The siege at the hospital takes a turn for the worse as Jack and Neil are taken hostage at gunpoint after an abortive attempt to free Roger. New DC Jo Masters takes charge of the delicate negotiations, while Steve realises only he can save Honey. Elsewhere, Samantha is appalled to learn Abi is carrying Hugh Wallis's baby and Terry begins to doubt whether his brother is guilty of the child abuse charges.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's new image doesn't work, Mandy takes Sam shopping, and a mugging takes place in broad daylight in the Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot arrives to nurse Jules. Rachel learns there is money in junk, Steve finds his enterprise shot down by Ian, a letter for Arthur leads to a goodbye, and Sam is nervous.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Tate fails a routine medical and is forced to take early retirement. Elsewhere, Malcolm receives his commendation for bravery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Concern grows after a seemingly depressed Tinker goes missing without explanation. Lovejoy eventually tracks him down to his sister's hotel on Burgh Island, which is about to be lost to a property developer. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's tries to rebuild his relationship with Susan come under threat when two feuding families decide to settle their differences in violent fashion - with a duel. John Nettles, Louise Jameson and James Warwick star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie is arrested for stealing a dustcart, Grandad is taken to hospital, Billy quarrels with Julie and Jack is nearly seduced by Carmen.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel's script about his early romance with Jean goes into production, but he is aghast at some of the liberties taken by the brash American producers, and tries to stop them making any radical changes. Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Stag Night of Doggy Wilkinson
programme.desc: Eric Sykes guest stars as absent-minded Doggy, who is disappointed when his stag night fails to live up to his expectations. However, Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle come up with a solution and soon rectify the situation. With Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are sent to investigate the discovery of a skeleton in an old Yorkshire mining town. When they are told the remains are those of a police officer who worked undercover during the miners' strike in the mid-1980s, the mismatched coppers begin to unravel a complex web of crimes. However, just when they think they are making progress, the killer strikes again.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates claims that celebrity chef Kitty Campbell murdered her husband Bertie during the 1960s. A former assistant of the couple claims Bertie was gay, and that she killed him for fear of a scandal wrecking her career - but Halford thinks they are being taken for a ride. Honor Blackman and Stephen Tompkinson guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Why would a normally mild-mannered museum security guard suddenly become a killer? Jardine and Reid's investigations lead them to suspect drugs might be responsible, and they soon uncover a connection with the obsessive world of bodybuilding. Starring James Macpherson, Blythe Duff, Colin McCredie and Iain Anders.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Terrified of being arrested, Andrew enlists Luke's help to set up an alibi, but Laura does not give up easily and the final confrontation between the two may have violent consequences. The concluding part of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, which followed the lives of teacher Laura Nielson and widowed surgeon Andrew Earlham after they found themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion after enjoying a date together. Starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Danny Webb and Shelley Conn.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Ashley, Roy, Lauren and Sue pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: A custody battle begins, Victoria takes back control of her life, and Pete leaves the village.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bethany warns Alya that Ray is probably trying to get her into bed, an exhausted David crashes while taking the kids to the school play, and Eileen calls in the factory, hoping to apply for the Customer Services job.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer advice to viewers about how to get the best deals possible on car and home insurance policies, some of the biggest bills to hit people's pockets. Plus, are you part of one of the 1.3 million households entitled to claim pension credit?.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Having downloaded Ray's legal files, Bethany and Daniel find a list of names including Michelle's with an asterisk next to them. David, Max and Lily extract themselves from the car wreckage, while Eileen and Alina are interviewed for the Underworld job.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam comes out on top, but his excitement is short-lived when reality hits, while Karen is put in an impossible position. In the wake of her mother's death, Jenny makes a discovery that sends her into a tailspin.¬†John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The former tabloid editor interviews Alan Sugar about his career and personal life. The Apprentice star discusses his financial and legal troubles, and the nervous breakdown he experienced while fighting a libel case. He also looks back on his teenage years, his controversial tenure as chairman of Tottenham Hotspur, and the untold story behind his company's satellite dishes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How plasterboard is made from power station smoke, the casting of the world's top awards, and how planes are built that can take off and land almost anywhere.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a hot rod mechanic with a super expensive collection of rare bubbletop cars.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items languishing in people's homes and use creative thinking and elbow grease to fix them up to turn a profit for their owners. Here they unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a special petrol tank.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team of experts tries to restore three family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory, working on a clock, a carving of a flying fish and an accordion.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a piano stool, clock restoration expert Steve works on a vintage telephone and antique projector specialist Richard Rigby enlivens a magic lantern.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Sludge takes a white-knuckle ride up a mountain with an angry load, Cameron carts a colossal dump truck out of the Nullarbor, and Steve dodges downpours on an urgent mission.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer attempts to turn a cheap runabout vehicle into a supercar in as few trades as possible. First, he heads to India and hopes to get the best deals in town.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A fully restored 1962 Corvette is brought into the garage and gets chopped and dropped. The crew sets out to retain the car's natural charm yet boost performance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini finds a rare 1934 Lincoln KB Convertible, but in order to buy it he must also purchase a 1970s Chrysler K-car and 1960s Buick convertible.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer and multi-talented mechanic Edd China are on a mission to find and restore iconic cars. They work on a 1960s GTO Pontiac..

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on the opening day at the Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring first-round matches.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini investigates a lead on a 1956 Citroen 2CV in North Carolina, as he suspects it could be one of the first of its kind to be imported into the US.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJC, an iconic 'corporate sports car' that is likely to attract plenty of admirers.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz meet Larry, who has the ultimate big boy toys including a rare Porsche and a pair of unusual pick-ups that really xreate some interest.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines strange salvage items at a beachside sale, which includes a collection of vintage skateboards and surfboards.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. A typhoon puts livelihoods on the line, with rookie skipper Josh Harris's weaknesses exposed and Captain Sig's control of the Northwestern in jeopardy.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the construction of large tunnels in one of the world's biggest cities to prevent blackouts, and a look at how a pine forest is turned into timber.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of delicious baklava, favourite sweet of the Ottomans. Plus, James Bond's gyroplane, the ukulele, and the Supercat - the world's fastest ferry.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Part two of two. At trial, a sensational family drama unfolded as Aaron Hernandez's fiancee testified for the prosecution. Later, links to another brutal slaying emerged.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How DNA testing can clear innocent suspects, even when all the circumstantial evidence points to their guilt.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The previously untold real-life copycat crimes and criminals reportedly inspired by cinematic release A Clockwork Orange. A group of teenagers, led by 14-year-old Chelsea, left a trail of victims in their wake.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.

programme.title: Casey Anthony: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Recounting one of the most talked-about cases in US legal history. As the trial began, the defence unleashed shocking allegations about Caylee and Casey's father - and the prosecution theorised on how Caylee died.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Lori Cooper is called to treat a dog rescued from an apartment fire, while officers check up on a rabbit breeder.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eager grooms accompany their fiancees on the hunt for dresses, and a former customer receives sad news when her engagement is broken off.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride's mother has firm ideas about the wedding dress, while another does not approve of her daughter's desire for a sexy look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride determined to stay within a strict budget is drawn to the most expensive dresses, while another customer insists that money is no object.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA investigators have a fight on their hands to enter the home of an owner who is overbreeding his dogs, and a suspected cockfighting operation is investigated.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators assist police at a commercial breeding facility where more than 200 Rottweilers are found, but their rescue efforts are hampered by a freak ice storm.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, with Kev Paxton and Simion Hawtin-Smith helping him transform a retro chair, gate rods and four dining chairs.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The forensic evidence presented in the OJ Simpson trial - the murder investigation and subsequent televised trial that took America by storm.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of lawyer Royal 'Scoop' Daniel, who vanished in 1997. It later became apparent the Colorado attorney had travelled to Mexico to evade charges of theft and commercial bribery, and it took almost five years to have him returned to America to face justice.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The investigation into 31-year-old Billy Smolinski's disappearance in 2004, which followed the discovery that girlfriend Madeleine Gleason had cheated on him. In 2012, Gleason sued Smolinski's mother and sister claiming they harassed, defamed and falsely accused her of involvement. However, police believe Smolinski was killed by someone related to Gleason, a suspect who has since died.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eternal bridesmaid Brittany, now the bride, wants to 'drop it low' in a dress. Erika plans to wear her old wedding dress down the aisle - with a different fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer and her picky entourage return to the shop for a second look, while a bride clashes with her mother over her choice of a non-traditional gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A well-endowed customer finds her dress is going to cost more than expected, and another bride finds her mother does not approve of her risque dress ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Mike Sorrentino arrives at Kleinfeld to help Melissa find her wedding gown. However, Mike and his brothers steal the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer fears her father will not approve of her dress, while another bride and her pushy dad try to find the perfect gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a feathered gown, to her parents' disapproval, while another customer likes every dress in the shop, while her relatives are less impressed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: HuffPost Live correspondent Caitlyn Becker visits the shop, but cannot decide between two dresses, while another customer wants the first gown she sees.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, with Kev Paxton and Simion Hawtin-Smith helping him transform a retro chair, gate rods and four dining chairs.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: At the global make-up event of the year, Beautycon, a nervous Reuben has a meet-and-greet. However, there's a gut-wrenching moment which could ruin his trip.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: A hairy and playful addition to the household is welcomed with open arms by the children. Then, the family reflects on the amazing year its had, and Reuben thinks about the future.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns visit the home of another polygamist family and are shocked to discover that they operate under a regime of discipline and rigidity.

programme.title: Raising Tourette's
programme.desc: Sam prepares to speak publicly about his Tourette's and Kristin must face her worst nightmare. Meanwhile, Kaden has a break down and needs his mother's support.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate the abduction of Christine Aragao and her two young children in Miami just days before Christmas, hoping to determine who has kidnapped them before it is too late.
